meta.hint: Use 'is' if the sentence is about one person, animal, place, or, thing. eg. Richard is funny. eg. It is brittle.  Use 'are' if the sentence is about more than one person, animal, place or  thing. Also, use 'are' if the sentence is about you. eg. Jake and Ron are late. eg. We are behind you. eg. You are so pretty.  Use 'am' if the sentence is about I. eg. I am not going there.
